subject: Dear Friend,
body:
Dear Friend,
I am Mrs. Bonnie Gomez a US citizen, 65 years Old. I reside here in
108 Crockett Court. Apt 303, New Braunfels Texas, United States, am
thinking of relocating since I am now rich. I am one of those that
took part in contract  in Nigeria many years ago and they refused to
pay me, I had paid over $30,000 usd while in the US, trying to get my
payment out all to no avail, before I was directed to contact one
Mrs.Loveth Kumah at  Dept Management office (DMO) in Nigeria, and
after contacted her she requested for my contract number and after
confirming my contract number, my fund was transfer to my account
immediately.
Right now I am the most happiest woman on  earth because I have
finally received my funds from Nigeria. Mrs. Loveth Kumah, showed me
the full info of those that are yet to receive their payments and I
saw your name and email address, as one of the beneficiaries, that is
why I decided to email you to stop dealing with those people,
contacting you from Nigeria because they are not with your
payment,they are only making money out of you.
I will advise you to contact  Mrs. Loveth Kemah. You have to contact
her directly through her below contact info:
Name: Mrs. Loveth Kumah
Email:lokemah201444@gmail.com
Dept. Management office (DMO)
Nigeria.
You really have to stop dealing with those people that are contacting
you and telling you that your fund is with them, it is not in anyway
with them, they are only taking advantage of you and they will dry you
up until you are left nothing.
Once again stop contacting those people, I will  advise you to contact
Mrs. Loverth Kumah and get your payment out as soon as possible
instead of dealing with those liars that will be turning you around
asking for different kind of money to complete your transaction.
Gomez

subject: Re:   Dear Friend,
body:
Dear Mrs. Bonnie Gomez,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I appreciate your concern and advice regarding my dealings with people from Nigeria. 

However, I would like to clarify that I have not been involved in any contracts in Nigeria or any other transactions that you mentioned in your email. It seems there might be a misunderstanding or mix-up of some sort.

I would advise you to double-check the information you received about me being involved in such activities. If there's anything else you need from me, feel free to ask.

Best wishes,
Tracy
